alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Montour; Northumberland; Southern Lycoming; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND... NORTHERN MONTOUR...SOUTHEASTERN LYCOMING...NORTHWESTERN COLUMBIA AND NORTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Williamsport, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamsport, Montoursville, Muncy, Watsontown, Hughesville, Montgomery, Duboistown, Allenwood, Jerseytown, Elimsport, Lairdsville, Collomsville, Exchange, Delaware Run, South Williamsport, Garden View, Turbotville, Picture Rocks, Oval and McEwensville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.

area.areaDesc: Columbia; Montour; Northumberland; Southern Lycoming; Union
